page.title: 10Trade - cont.
page.content: as they didn't have cars in those days and buses had solid tyres.There were four butchers, three fish and chip shops, in fact there were about eight food shops. 'As small boys we often jumped on the carrier at the back and get a lift down the road. An interesting point is that it used to take 55 minutes for a bus to get to Ipswich from Wickham before the war and here we are in 1985 and it still takes the same time'. Mr. Taylor thought that in the future there would be more houses built in Wickham and because petrol would become so expensive the people wouldn't be able to afford to go out to the shops other than "Taylors of Wickham Market".
